page.title: 17Enniskillen Refuse Disposal
page.content: The public dump covers some 12 acres with a further 6 acres in reserve. The area once was a lightly wooded valley which was excavated to 18 metres.Rubbish is collected from all over Fermanagh in 6 bin lorries,each with a capacity of 17 tonnes. There are 10 lorry loads per working day. Collections are also made in 11 mobile skips serviced by 2 skip lorries. To prevent disease & festation by vermin the waste is disposed of in layers covered by soil. Further precautions include spraying insecticide,spreading poison for rat control, & a gas-gun to keep the birds at bay. A dog pound has been completed in 1985 & it is situated at the entrance to the dump. Some 600 abandoned cars are stored yearly awaiting the mobile crusher from the east of the Province.
